result.execSummary:
The defendant Tanya R. Hohlstein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tanya R. Hohlstein is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tanya R. Hohlstein was found guilty of Injury by Intoxicated Use/Vehicle, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Maintain absolute sobriety.  Not go on premises where alcohol is sold for on site consumption, except for employment.  6 month review.  AODA and comply.  Submit DNA sample.  Ct. 2 DISMISSED.  Restituition to be determined by hearing.

Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared for the defendant. Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Zaleski has a conflict with Friday's hearing, will be in Milwaukee all day. records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order reversing

records.addlTxt: Filed by atty Zaleski, requesing a reset of the 9-22-17 hearing on restitution.
Restitution hearing on September 22, 2017 at 09:00 am.

The Court ordered that the restitution component of the amended judgment of conviction is summarily reversed under Wis Stat Rule 809.21(1), and this matter is remanded to have the circuit court hold an evidentiary hearing on restitution.  The vacation of the restitution order does not otherwise affect the original judgment of conviction, which remains in effect.  This summary disposition order will not be published.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tanya R. Hohlstein in court, in custody with attorney Mark Walter Frank.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Frank motioned for Huber be reinstated. ADA Cross objected. Further argument by Atty. Frank. Court denied motion.

Restitution Order in the amount of $164.082.08

Defendant Tanya R. Hohlstein in court, in custody with attorney Mark Walter Frank.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No agreement has been reached on restitution.  State requested a recess to discuss restitution amount.  Court granted request, called recess.  11:08/11:10.  Court resumed.  Argument by State and defense regarding restitution.  Defendant took oath as witness.  Direct examination by attorney Frank.  No cross examination.  Witness excused.  Court found $164,182.08 as special damages that is to be entered as a judgment for the restitution.  Court found defendant has ability to pay, will grant long term payment plan if necessary.  11:16/11:39.

Defendant Tanya R. Hohlstein in court with attorney Mark Walter Frank.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victims M.K., T.K., and C.P. gave statements.  Closing arguments by ADA Long and Atty Mark Frank.  Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 7 years 6 months.  Conditions of probation include:  AODA and comply.  $518.00 costs.  Submit DNA sample. 9 month jail, with Huber.  Start today at 7 pm.    Maintain absolute sobriety.  Not go on premises where alcohol is sold for on site consumption.  Except for employment.  6 month review.  Restitution is to be determined with a hearing.

Sentencing hearing at 12-01-2015 11:00 am

Defendant Tanya R. Hohlstein in court with attorney Mark W. Frank.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joint recommendation; today is plea only so victim can be present. Ct 1. Injury by  Intoxicated Use of Motor Vehicle.   Ct 2 dismissed.  Sentence wihheld, Probation:  5 years, 6 months jail consecutive to any other sentence, costs $518.00, AODA and treatment.  DNA sample.  Restitution to be argued.  Civil cases dismissed.  Court requested past record be available at sentencing.  Rights/elements.  No contest plea to Ct 1.  Defendant found guilty, JOC entered.  Sentencing date to be obtained today if possible.  Ct 2 and civil citations dismissed.  Bond continued.
